channel.title: Need some data
channel.description:
Well, I have to do this project about time spent on school, and I need to know how much time people spend on school. Now I know, I can just ask some kids at my own school, but this is quite an international forum. It may give me more points if I add times from other countries too. So what I basicly need is the following:
Country: (what country are you from :P) Time spent travelling to and from school: (how long does it take you to go to school and back to home, so that are two trips) Time spent at school: (quite obvious) Time spent on homework: (per day)
Well, that's about it. Thanks in advance!

item.title: Need some data
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

Country: USA
Time spent travelling to and from school: To: 15-20 minutes (car)
Time spent at school:6 hours
Time spent on homework: daily homework 20 minutes projects - 2 to 8 hours

Read full topic

just make it up u faghat
[/quote]
i concur, dis is good advice.

Btw bootnecklad what did you mean by quite obvious?

I fucked up on my quoting… fixed now because I don’t spend 7 1/2 hours on homework.

item.title: Need some data
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Country: England
Time spent traveling to and from school: 7 minutes to school, over 20 minutes to get home
Time spent at school: 7 Hours 30 Minutes
Time spent on homework: We are meant to get some every night but we don’t when I do get some

screw doing that, I either do a half assed job or just don’t do it at all, which results in sweet sweet nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some data
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Country: England, United Kingdom.
Time spend travelling to and from school: 10 minutes when I use bike, 5 when i get driven in by my mum.
Time spent at school: 8 hours a day.
Time spent on homework: We are expected to do 2 hours a night, but screw doing that, I either do a half assed wikipedia job or just don’t do it at all, which results in sweet sweet nothing.

Read full topic
